summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between defense attorney Joseph E. Nascimento and federal prosecutors (AUSAs) from the Southern District of New York, primarily concerning the scheduling of meetings and interviews with Nascimento's client, who is cooperating with the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails span from July 2019 to April 2021 and discuss logistical details, client status, and reactions to Maxwell's arrest.

persons.name: Joseph E. Nascimento
persons.context: Attorney representing a client who is cooperating with the SDNY investigation into Epstein and Maxwell. He is scheduling meetings and proffers with prosecutors and checking on his client's status.

persons.name: Alan Ross
persons.context: Deceased former law partner of Joseph Nascimento who previously represented the client now represented by Nascimento.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of her arrest in July 2020, which prompted Nascimento to check in with prosecutors.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The investigation referenced in the emails is related to him, as indicated by the email subject lines.

connections.description: Were law partners; Nascimento took over representation of Ross's client after Ross's death.
Nascimento is the attorney for an unnamed client who is cooperating with the SDNY investigation.
Nascimento is in ongoing communication with federal prosecutors to schedule his client's cooperation, including proffers and interviews.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's Arrest
events.description: Nascimento references seeing reports of Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest and checks in with prosecutors.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Served
events.description: A federal agent served a grand jury subpoena on Nascimento's client, prompting his initial contact with SDNY prosecutors.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting at Hilton West Palm Beach
events.description: A meeting was scheduled between Nascimento, his client, and SDNY prosecutors at the Hilton in West Palm Beach.

events.title: Scheduled Proffer Session
events.description: A proffer session (a meeting where a subject provides information to prosecutors) was scheduled for Nascimento's client.

events.title: Scheduled Call with Prosecutors
events.description: A call was scheduled between Nascimento and SDNY prosecutors to discuss potentially scheduling a client interview for early May.

locations: 2250 S.W. 3rd Avenue, Miami, Florida 33129 (Nascimento's law office)
Hilton in West Palm Beach, 600 Okeechobee Blvd, West Palm Beach, Florida
keyFacts: Attorney Joseph Nascimento represents a cooperating client in the SDNY's Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
The client's prior attorney was Alan Ross, who died in 2018; Nascimento took over as the inventory attorney.
The client was served with a grand jury subpoena in July 2019, initiating Nascimento's contact with SDNY prosecutors.
Prosecutors stated they appreciated the client's cooperation and that her status had not changed negatively from their perspective.
Communications include scheduling multiple in-person proffer meetings in Florida, primarily at a Hilton in West Palm Beach.
